did.unittitle: Geographical surveys west of the 100th meridian (U.S.) papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains letterpress copies of letters signed by Wheeler and other officers of the survey, registers of correspondence sent and received, records of meteorological and topographical observations, atlas sheets, and photographs and stereoscope views of parts of the territory covered by the expeditions.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Geographical Surveys West of the 100th Meridian (U.S.)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Unspecified. Please consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Geographical Surveys West of the 100th Meridian Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Geographical Surveys West of the 100th Meridian Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: HISTORICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: The Geographical Surveys West of the 100th Meridian, also known as the Wheeler Survey, grew out of the Army's desire to create maps featuring the geological aspects of the West, man-made improvements, and the "conformation, obstacles and resources of the country." Commanded by Lieutenant George Montague Wheeler, the survey was originally intended to cover the territory lying south of the Central Pacific Railroad, but grew in scope by 1872 to a mapping of all of the United States west of the 100th meridian. The survey ended on June 30, 1879, when the bill creating the U. S. Geological Survey became effective.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains letterpress copies of letters signed by George M. Wheeler and other officers of the survey, registers of correspondence sent and received, records of meteorological and topographical observations, atlas sheets, and photographs and stereoscope views of the territory covered by the expeditions.

controlaccess.subject: Stereoscopic views

Photographs
Photographs of Geographical Explorations and Surveys West of the 100th Meridian. 2 vols.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One volume contains 25 prints, the other, 50 prints. Photographers: Timothy O'Sullivan and William Bell.
